column4: There is a workaround but it is suggested that people wait for the real fix if they can
What does fglrxinfo  from cli show you
http://pastebin.ubuntu-nl.org/53103/
Which ATI card is it?
ryan@ryan-laptop:~$ lspci | grep Radeon --> 01:05.0 VGA compatible controller: ATI Technologies Inc RC410 [Radeon Xpress 200M]
And you have always used fglrx?
as far as I know, yes. I have always used whatever the restricted manager provided.
What is the exact problem you are having?
I very poor 3D performance and glxinfo reports that direct rendering is not enabled, whereas in the past direct rendering has worked and I've gotten better 3D performance.
Thanks for being helpful, I'll be back if Nickrud's suggestion doesn't work.
from our repos or from outside official repos
I have main, universe, and multiverse enabled. Plus the winehq repo, but that should have nothing to do with this.
Did you post your xorg for me?
I did. The latest xorg is here: http://pastebin.ubuntu-nl.org/53108/
It should look more like mine..   http://pastebin.ubuntu-nl.org/53112/
I know, but it's way more minimal than that.
Stuck going into +1..
I know you have been waiting a long time for help in +1 but that is the place you need to go for those answers
try to find hirens cd it is bootable cd with misc tools
